What a powerful event that if any aliens our there would know to do, it's a smart thing they would do, ... Destroy the moon and earth will collapse momentarily. Great point. I've seen tons on UFO movies but none which aliens used their minds to create such true science conclusion. I love it. The idea stands out in the movie the most to me. Secondly, jack and Victoria DNA was used for cloning multiple techs to monitor earth is very well a possible idea aliens can do to use humans to work for them, which is what most scientists believed about the ancient gods, or Zachariah sitchin books depicts. How humans where created or made to work for them, as how we today build machines and robots. Wonderful idea in this conclusion. No movie is perfect. No director nor book writers got it all figured out. After all, its still only just a movie for us to enjoy, and not some real documentary of any known UFO factuals. But given the technology we have today and the geology studies and astronomy research, this movie makes good sense. I give it a 10 for its pure fun and interesting science conclusions and plots. I also like to give a 10 for Tom Cruise on his success in this film because when it comes to sci fi, only he and will smith has movies worth watching.

Some movie reviewers are just not up to watching SciFi. It's the only reason for tepid reviews to me. If it ain't StarWars or StarTrek they won't get it.No movie is perfect including this one. My very lightweight knocks on Oblivion are: 1) You won't leave the theater meditating on the meaning of life, the universe or human consciousness (like say The Matrix Part 1, or Inception). 2) You won't deeply hate the antagonist when he/she/they/it get what is so richly deserved. It's there, because it has to be there, but it's not over-sold.Oblivion is nowhere near as complex as Avatar, StarWars, StarTrek etc, but it IS a complete story and well told. The entire plot holds together for me, with a very few (non-fatal) glitches.Seeds for the plot twists are there, but you may not catch them so you can be surprised. You will be amazed at the set designer's earth-based mechanicals and architecture (stuff that might even humble a Steve Jobs). Watch for the swimming pool. Off-planet stuff looks like the work of a different crew, over-reaching and derivative, but minor.The characters are well written, directed and acted. You will like Cruise's lead character immediately (unlike say John Carter or the Great and Powerful Oz). "The Camera Loves Him" - even at age 50 with Cruise's face touching 3-4 sides of the screen. He can also ACT that close up. You will like his character in part because he is well written, but also well directed and very well acted. Tom's real-life wacky SciFi faith might have cost him two amazing wives, but it didn't take away his ability to perform. Might even help, a topic for another day. I say: Rock-solid SciFi storytelling. You'll get your money's worth, even if you buy the big popcorn and a drink... and IMAX.

Review title: Oblivion - Proper SF despite a couple of pretty serious mistakes
Review_body: Summary: The world was attacked by the Scavengers. They destroyed the moon, which caused many natural disasters across the planet. The war was eventually won by the humans after deploying nuclear weaponry, but afterward the planet was mostly uninhabitable. The humans now live on Titan, a moon of Saturn, apart from a few who stayed behind in a large space station, or on earth, where large machines now harvest water for fusion energy. Some remaining Scavengers continue to disrupt that process. Drones defend the machines, and a few humans remain to repair the drones if they get damaged.Jack (Cruise) is such a repairman. Assisted by his communications partner and girlfriend Vika (Riseborough) he finds damaged drones and repairs them, or takes them back to his base/home if he doesn't have the parts to repair them on the spot. Jack often dreams of a woman (Kurylenko), and is haunted by several "memories" that he is not supposed to have because of a memory wipe he had to undertake for security reasons. This causes him to question the things around him, and gets him into trouble. I will stop here, because otherwise I will reveal too much.Oblivion is a post-apocalyptic SF movie with a couple of upsides and a couple of downsides. Let me start with the downsides, so I can end on a positive note. ;-)1. The movie contains lots of plot ideas that were already used in other movies. It's not a one on one copy of another SF movie, but there are many things that are not very original.2. The movie is pretty predictable. There were many plot twists that I saw coming, even though I am pretty naive when I am watching movies. I didn't really mind this, but I am sure some will.3. There is a pretty extensive list of mistakes they made in the movie. Some of them bothered me a bit, most of them not really, but if you are a severe critic when watching movies, they might stop you from enjoying the movie. Other reviews reveal that this is a serious possibility.4. The acting isn't perfect. Cruise does a decent job, but the problems arise with the supporting cast. They just don't seem to get the chance to have their characters develop properly. Freeman should have had way more screen time, and Riseborough also doesn't get the chance to make Vika grow on us. Kurylenko does get quite some time to have her character develop, but she seems to just underperform. Not sure who is to blame here though. Might be the director's fault instead of Kurylenko's.Now, enough with the criticism. Time for some upsides! And the movie deserves a positive end note, because I enjoyed watching it a lot, despite of its flaws.1. Visually, the movie is spectacular! The large machines look great, the destroyed moon looks great, the action scenes are really nice and the combat drones are outright frightening. Their speed and efficiency are really impressive. The landscapes from the destroyed planet Earth are also very beautifully made.2. The plot, though somewhat unoriginal and containing many errors, is actually really interesting. The starting point is nice, and there are many twists that I liked. An SF fan should definitely not be disappointed by it. If we compare this plot to say Star Trek (2009) or the Transformers movies, it is quite a relief to finally watch a proper story again.3. The speed of the movie is very good! If you read other reviews, you will find that some thought the movie was slow. Perhaps they liked the speed of the last Total Recall movie, but normal movie fans will find one big roller-coaster of action sequences and special effects just tiring and pointless. The slower pace in Oblivion helps us familiarize with the characters and the story. If the movie would have been any faster than this, the story would have become one big mess and we would not at all have been able to enjoy character development (which I feel was already lacking a bit in the current pace).Conclusion: I would rate this movie a 7/10. Yes, there are many flaws, but I enjoyed the movie a lot, and there is lots to enjoy about it. Most SF movies have plot errors, but that's what you get if you make a movie with a complex plot, action sequences, special effects, a love story and so on. SF movies are never perfect, and this one is a solid effort. To a general audience I would say 'mildly recommended'. For SF fans it's a must see, though it probably won't become your all time favorite.

Review title: One of the best Sci-fic Movies i have ever seen!
Review_body: .. just exceptionally great movie. If you pay attention to details and try to actually watch a movie. Try not to find the things, focus what would happen next... because this is science fiction movie not thriller nor mystery. This movie is great when you look at how well story is spread out with music (if you watched with IMAX, you would know it is just the best work on sound) as well as the emotions/ mood created each moment. I have never felt satisfied after watched a movie like this before! Don't watch this movie with bias like "oh it is tom cruise" "oh this doesn't have great something.. blah blah" Watch this without comparing with any other sci-fic movie. This movie is different than other sci-fic packed with actions nor crazy sci-fic effects. One sentence describing the "Oblivion".. "The best sci-fic movie with great execution, sound... and everything about it." Recommend this movie 4.5/5 for sure.

This movie was a utter waste of a Saturday night and $50.00. I love movies and can pretty much look past bad acting as long as it has some good effects. This movie had nothing special, some laser beams, flying golf balls with guns and an upside down floating pyramid. The storyline had you wondering the entire movie, what??? I never in my life fell asleep during a movie twice. I forced myself to wake up, thinking I was missing something only to find out I missed nothing. The only thing I missed out on was a good nap. While I was sleeping I would hear an explosion and wake up instantly thinking "Oh my god, you're missing the action!! WAKE UP!!" but when I opened my eyes it would all be over. I asked my wife "What did I miss?" only to find her snoring away. I'm shocked this movie has received 7 stars. It should receive 2 stars at most as that's how many famous stars are acting in it. Hollywood keeps wondering why people are stealing their movies online. It's cause they keep putting out junk like this. I'm sure the Tom Cruise fans will love it just because he is in it.

Review title: Doesn't make a full circle (flight recorder)
Review_body: "Oblivion" --fault line!? Did anyone else notice that the flight recorder was the one "link". That can't link the two pieces together? Watch it and figure out why. I enjoyed the movie/plot and similarities from other movies. Because It made it all gel together. like a common "sci-if" storyline. All in all this was a great movie. I just feel they Should/could have linked it better~ I would enjoy watching this again with friends down the road. The best parts at the end... But to understand Why you have to watch it all the way through. I hope you enjoy it too. Keep up the good work and great reviews. Btw this having to Post 10 lines here to give a clean quick review sucks. :P.

As someone else wrote here, this movie plot is rip off of other movies. It seems that there is nothing original about this movie. Visual effects are good, but plot of this movie evolves in a very slow pace with only few surprises. Therefore this movie is boring. I could have tell the plot of this movie to a friend in a 5 minutes. The thing is that this 5 minutes is extended to 2 hours. Such a disappointment. Not even Morgan Freeman appearance in this movie could save it and when I say appearance I mean appearance as he may be at the movie maybe for 5 minutes. Maybe a little longer. There are a few logical holes in the plot. The story of the movie was the major flaw for me. It seems like there wasn't much thought put into it. Filmmakers just patched scenes together with visual effects somehow following the story enough for this movie to be presented to the public. Previews for this movie were exciting, but the movie itself is a big failure.

The special effects were excellent. The acting was good. The story was spoiled, clichéd and full of mistakes.I watched the spoiler which already spoiled that the Scavs were in fact the humans. I expected another huge turn around, but it never happened.At times the drones fire with excellent precision and superhuman speed, at other times they miss shots a child wouldn't miss or wait for seconds before firing.I thought it was funny when the movie explained why the Scavs wore those ridiculous outfits.....stealth, hilarious.The recorder that was found with the life pods was detached from Jack and Vika, but still contained their voices from after detachment.Jack 49 came to Vika 52 with bruises and cuts on his face. She asks him if the mission went OK, he says nothing happened, all is fine....I can probably continue for a bit, it might be nitpicking, but i do know it annoys me a lot and i do not have the same feeling with most other movies.

Review title: Did not live up to its potential...
Review_body: Wellanother movie that did not live up to its potential. The premise of this movie was great. The story was not. It lacked serious development and really fell flat. The story seems more like a pitch developed for the producers. "This movie will be about this and that involving him and her and a few others with this and that action thrown in and this is how it all will turn out. And, hey, Tom Cruise wants to be in it!" About half way through the movie I started to feel terribly disappointed. OKto be honest, I felt disappointed after the prologue. Part of a great movie is letting the story unfold as it happens. What do they say about writing a good story?—show don't tell!I want to care about the characters in a movie. I'm a very sensitive guy—I cry at the drop of a hat. Seriously, I didn't once feel for any of the characters in this film—nary had a tear well up in my eyes. The science fiction portion of the film was never seriously developed either. There was just too much bouncing back and forth between a love story and the science fiction story of which neither engaged. It seemed like the writers and director were trying to make a love story with a science fiction subplot. Unfortunately, they failed on both accounts.How about the action? Some of the action stuff was a bit unbelievable. The scenes involving the drones seemed terribly unrealistic. However, with that said, there wasn't too much action—there just wasn't enough of anything else.I love science fiction when done well. I like love stories when done well. The potential was great for both in this movie. I think all the actors did a good job—the writing and direction were just not up to snuff. This was just another one of those movies that you wish you could go back a do all over. I believe script writers, producers and directors should take the lead from authors who write great stuff—sometimes you have to do it over and over and over again to get it right. The first couple of drafts are rarely worthy of publication.(OhSound effects were great; however, I didn't really see any advantage to this movie being done in IMAX. Most of the scenes just seemed flatmuch like the story. And, I have to disagree with those that loved the soundtrack...it didn't' do much for me either.)

Review title: Maybe spectacular if your IQ is below 80
Review_body: The story is dull, immature and unrealistic all the way through. I recently watched Scavengers, just for comparison, an excellent B-movie in my opinion which had more convincing directing than this. This movie gives the word 'generic' a whole new meaning. I wouldn't even consider this sci-fi (due to lack of realism) but rather fantasy romance/drama.This movie is an excellent example for what happens if you want to reach the largest audiences by finding the lowest common denominator. Mindless action sequences paired with romance, emotional waffling and a story directed so overly simplified that it can easily be understood by 3 year olds. Then just pump loads of money into CGI and everyone will like it ...I have seen 10 times better Twilight Zone episodes and whatever budget they had, it must have been at least 500 times lower.

Review title: Awesome movie w/ great characters and plot
Review_body: There are a few movies (Sphere, Vanilla Sky, Solaris) that don't necessarily get the best ratings but are top on my all time favorites. This is now one of them. Not going to say much other than I loved the special effects, character progression, overall plot, and awesome job from the actors/actresses. When you continue to think about a movie for several days after watching it, you know it really had an impact and succeeded in captivating your thoughts and attention.I loved that it didn't focus solely on special affects or action. There was a legitimate story line that never failed to carry me all the way through without boring me. A few times I caught myself whispering things like, "whoa, that's crazy", or "didn't expect that"... Not something I usually do throughout a movie. Even subtle details like the open nuclear missile doors on the submarines was a delight to catch.If you haven't scene the movie, go check it out! I can almost guarantee you won't be disappointed!

Review title: Good movie but you would need to follow along very closely in order to fully appreciate the plot line
Review_body: Oblivion was excellent and truly one of the best movies i have seen this year. a great sci-fi that has many plot twist. What made me love this movie is that even when watching the trailers, you only get a very vague general ideas with many possible incidents. I have to say to the people who take this movie apart piece by piece to watch the movie again and appreciate it for what it is. The plot is great and I never even saw the plot twist coming. Oblivion's Plot may have been the best I have seen in a while (of Course putting in the cliché ending, but what movie doesn't have that anymore). The plot line is creative full of surprises and is the main reason why oblivion should be watched

A brief review of the movie 'Oblivion'I should start by saying that there will be a couple spoilers coming up, so if you really want to see Oblivion, frankly after seeing it I cannot imagine why you would, don't read any further. This is a spoiler alert.I cannot easily express in words how bored and disappointed I was with this movie. It is tediously predictable, with stereotypical (main plot) characters with no real character development to speak of.There's the 'bad ass' military guy (Tom Cruise), the 'emotionally broken/O.A.G.' lover character (Andrea Riseborough), and the 'surprise! I'm actually your wife' character who's supposed to be an important character to the overall story but you just don't care (Olga Kurylenko), and then we come to the 'Old guy who's kinda strange and is thought to be the enemy, but actually knows sh#t, and is actually a good guy' character (Morgan Freeman). We're expected to care about these characters, especially the first 3 mentioned, but you honestly don't. You especially have no reason to after it hits about the 1.5hr mark when a (read: another) predictable event happens (the "enemy" are actually people not aliens, and the "good guys" are actually the alien bad guys...).Tom Cruise played his role fairly well, but it was similar to many other roles he's had. He's really the only character you sort of care about to a small extent. Andrea Riseborough was just plain annoying, she reminded me of Overly Attached Girlfriend to be honest. Olkga Kurylenko didn't play the role very well, however her role wasn't brilliant anyway. Morgan Freeman was unsurprisingly the best in his role, and suited his character very well as the old guy who knows sh#t.There are scenes in Oblivion which I couldn't help but think "Man, this director really is a fan of Star Wars". There's just so many things wrong with this movie, things which should be a basic feature of any movie (except for perhaps a porno) - Character development: You won't find any of that here. Original plot ideas: You won't find these here either. Plot twists/interesting events: Again, something which doesn't exist here. The feeling of being immersed in another world: Nope.I went into this movie actually expecting something somewhat substantial, I mean this movie does have Morgan Freeman after all! Sadly, I was presented with a 2.5hr long sleeping pill. I literally held off going to the toilet just to distract myself from the boring misery on the screen, just to have something else to do.I suppose it was visually well done, and I did like the scene where Tom Cruise fights Tom Cruise, but other than that it was a complete waste of time that I'm never getting back. I hope Morgan Freeman was paid a lot of money for this role, because it's by far the worse movie I've seen him in; I'm including the 'Evan All Mighty' series of films in this too.TLDR: Oblivion is a bad movie. Don't waste your time.

Review title: Unimaginative SF film with an interest in Macaulay
Review_body: The production values are good but to me this seemed like an unimaginative version of good earthlings defeat bad alien. And for some unexplained reason Thomas Babington Macaulay's book of poetry "Lays of Ancient Rome" had a part in the movie. They quote a stanza from it "Then out spake brave Horatius,The Captain of the Gate:"To every man upon this earthDeath cometh soon or late.And how can man die betterThan facing fearful odds,For the ashes of his fathers,And the temples of his gods," I suppose this is meant to represent Tom Cruise's character's struggle against alien oppression. I got a copy of this book from the library (1875 edition). This poem, Horatius, is pretty heavy stuff with numerous references to ancient Rome. What was the purpose of the movie makers in mentioning this poem? Do they want us to run out of the theater and go to the library to get a copy?I was also disappointed with the role that Olga Kurylenko was given in the movie. It consisted mostly of staring agape at Tom Cruise. Too bad really; what a waste. She had a much better part in "Quantum of Solace" , the recent Bond film.

Review title: An intense SCI Movie to watch with music volume set on high
Review_body: This movie hooked me up on the early beginning by its theme song. And this movie, in my humble opinion, its all about its music. CGI was perfect, acting perfect as fit. Story, nothing really new but enough to keep you interested. Few characters so you can keep a clear mind. And all that glued with a perfect soundtrack, making the movie timing perfect, with a very genuine pace. This movie it's about feeling and experience. So a good movie system is required. It's not a groundbreaking movie, or something that would change you or history of the cinema. Even so, its pure entertainment - to watch alone, with a friend or a companion.

Review title: Big rip off of The Moon but good movie in the end
Review_body: I loved this movie, I don't know why people are saying it is confusing I followed it quite well. But I have to say big rip off of the moon. The moon was about a guy on the dark side of the moon who sends back parcels of a resource that has helped diminish Earth's power problems. He then discovers a dead clone in a rover and starts to investigate. The moon wasn't a great movie, but it also used cloning and the main character also found out he was a clone. Also I thought the ending was a rip off of the movie independence day.For me Oblivion was just a mixture of these movies. But it was still a very good movie. If I hadn't seen the moon then I would defiantly give this movie a 10.

I was really hesitant to watch this movie, the trailer looked good, but I wasn't sure. My friend and I watched it last night actually, and I found the movie actually quite good.Its that kind of movie that leaves you wanting more, and the end was a crazy twist! Over all there were a lot of twists, and I found myself captured. It was really good, in my opinion.Jack, and the tent. And then Victoria, and his wife Julia or Amanda as her name turned out to be? I don't even know there...I watched the trailer, and it said Morgan Freeman, I made a joke and said automatically that we were going to watch it. I like almost cried, when they carried him off and it looked like he died. Then in the end he was at the tent with Jack, and died. I was like PLOT TWIST! Woah! And then Jack's wife had a kid... and his clone was there, and it was like holy crap! Over all a really good movie. I suggest watching it.

I liked this movie very much, hence a 10. The pace and flow was slow and faltered a couple of times but then picked up again. That is my only negative about this movie and is minor.The graphics and special effects were very good and engaging.The story line is complex enough to be interesting and isn't one of the typical, overused, and predictable Hollywood scenarios. The movie might be hard to follow if not a sci-fi and futurist fanThere are several themes and archetypes used, some are: pyramid (the Tet), compartmentalization, DNA memory, artificial intelligence, drones, and clones. Good stuff for sci-fi fans.The gist is man versus machine or biological intelligence versus artificial intelligence, and since humans made this movie, the humans win.

Review title: Great film in the "end of the world" genre !
Review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this film, which fits admirably into the 'end of the world' genre. Technical effects are top notch, and the props are reminiscent of the Star Trek series in their quality and cool factor. But what blew me away mostly was the landscape photography which is really what gives this movie it's character. Watching the credits at the end one finds out it was mostly filmed in Iceland, hence the astoundingly stark moonscape type backdrops. Now I want to travel to that country ! Good acting and superb directing from Kosynski, though the script is a bit hard to follow at times. I won't go into that not to give anything away, suffice it to say you have to pay attention... Enjoy !

Review title: An astoundingly well thought out sci-fi flick.
Review_body: This is truly a fantastic sci-fi film. This year really hasn't been one for the critics, who, for the most part have mis-judged every film that I have seen. Perhaps the critics are becoming too critical, or too politically correct, both of which impair their ability to see a good film when one is right in front of them.Onto the film itself and it has all that one would expect of a good scifi, mystery, suspense, incredible visuals, a 'what happens next' scenario and a few loud bangs thrown in for good measure. Tom cruise plays his part amazing, especially considering the complexity of the character he plays (revealed in the movie). And any movie containing merely the voice of Morgan Freeman is always worth a watch. This film is not dumbed down, it does even attempt to make one think about life and the world, so perhaps that is why the critics disliked it (hehe). I would not say its a top 250 (imdb) but its definitely a movie that I will always recommend, and when attempting to find fault, i was unable to find enough of one to warrant any other rating than 10/10. But I am a scifi fan, who likes to think, so it may not appeal to everyone ;)

Review title: A very well made Sci-Fi movie. Reminds of many Sci-Fi movies yet is distinct in its own ways.
Review_body: I don't believe I was late in watching this movie. But am glad i did. The concept of the movie is awesome! It just keeps you guessing throughout the film. If you like sci-fi, you will surely enjoy this one. The whole presentation of the movie is classic! The action, the actors, wonderful visuals of earth, the music and the well-done special effects, simply superb!Tom Cruise is at his best. I love Morgan Freeman and he is also done a great job in the movie. I would surely recommend to watch it if you haven't!

There is something about this movie that seemed oddly familiar. Oh yeah, It's Sam Rockwell's "Moon"!!! Though they added their story-line, the main concept of the protagonist is the same (ie: The protagonist is a clone of a long dead original being used as a somewhat of a slave without their knowledge then realizes it by finding another clone from a divided section of the planet). Overall this was a good film, great cinematography, score, and cast. I just feel like its not as epic as you want it to be because you've seem something similar. Its like drinking a name brand soda and then taking swig a generic store brand. Its worth seeing, don't get me wrong, just don't call it a full on original.

Review title: This is a very good sci fiction Movie
Review_body: This is the Best Out on its on Sci Fiction movie I've seen in a very long time. As good as the Star Trek movies but no comparison More movies like it please My Faith in Tom Cruise is restored. Worst Sci-Fi I've seen is Another Earth M Knight Salaman needsto find new day job .... This is the Best Out on its on Sci Fiction movie I've seen in a very long time. As good as the Star Trek movies but no comparison More movies like it please My Faith in Tom Cruise is restored. Worst Sci-Fi I've seen is Another Earth M Knight Salaman needsto find new day job ....

First hour of film looks promising! Nice calm built up of the story. No booming and blasting images like most of the tiring Hollywood productions. In the first hour you wonder in excitement what will come next and how the story develops. Unfortunately in the second hour the movie totally collapses because there is a strong parallel with the movies "Moon" and "Independence day". Actually "Oblivion" is more spiced up version of "Moon" with almost the same ending as "Independence day". And that's really the stupid part of the movie. An alien identity with the smartest of high tech (scanning) gear just let's good old Tom Cruise fly into the heart of the mother-ship with a bomb, where Tommy throw some heroic philosophical dialog lines in the air and of course blows up the mother-ship. Leaving you behind wondering why you spend 2 hours watching a movie that in fact is a total rip of the script of "Moon" with many faults.

Review title: A truly stunning visual experience, but do not judge it by its cover
Review_body: Before I begin my first review I will say that there will be spoilers.I really wanted to like this movie. But the screenwriters had a brain slip thinking that stunning visuals (much better than average CGI), some nice music and reliable actors "Mr.Sci" Tom Cruise and "Mr.Awesome" Morgan Freeman could carry this movie. The 4 shining stars the movie get is from the above alone. The remaining 6 collapsed stars are just bad decisions...I will ignore the fact that the first 20 minutes of the film contain the teachings of a certain Hubbard; IRL I would rant about this but not here.Instead I make the case that this movie is Moon, with sprinkles of a love story and some action. I will go as far as saying that this is a blatant and plain bad Moon remake. Some guys are, unbeknownst to them, working for an adversary (insert bad corp from Moon), there are lots of them (Moon), they are promised to go to a better place (insert end of work shift from Moon). But they are a bit different, and discover the true nature of the beast (Moon), and...But why they are even there to begin with is awfully bizarre. Maintenance crew? Really? Is it that smart of the very intelligent entity to keep humans as such? I refuse to believe that it need some external beings to maintain it.Then again, it is not that intelligent. It seem to suffer from conditional strokes. The very advanced pattern recognition it exercise just vanishes sometimes. Perhaps it needed a repairman(?). My favorite part is when in a total of 15 seconds of screen time, it confess its stupidity: "I detect that you breathe heavily, your heart rate is rising, voice analysis show you're lying, there are 2 of you, and" *bzz* "Oh, I could at least have installed minor means to detect radioactive material. In the war you kinda used nukes on us. But then again, we really need to end this flick".Simply not buying it Hollywood. More brain next time and the stars will shine anew.

Not much to say, an epic journey with an amazing soundtrack for all of us hi-F lovers! Full of surprises and without to much, it brings a story for mind and soul. Less is sometimes better. Cruise fills this story with a few others to a maximum adventure where the world is at it's final moment. Beautiful effects and a breathtaking finish, shows once again that Kosinski delivers. Once again, the soundtrack is amazing and i recommend to see the movie twice to fully appreciate it's awesomeness. A simple movie like this can sometimes be the most powerful one.Best regards Alexander

Believe me when I say that I do not like movies because of the actors that are in them. The movies have to be good regardless of the director or film star. I say this because the last movie that completely blew me away was Vanilla Sky and now another Tom Cruise movie has done the same. I couldn't find fault with it. At all. Its visually stunning and yet very understated, not once did I feel that the creators were showing off as is so common these days. The OST is unbelievable. M83 have managed a score that easily equals Hans Zimmer, Michael Kamen and Thomas Newman. I can't speak highly enough of the music and its part in my appreciation of the film. It is simply beautiful and used to great effect throughout. Cruise is on top form and looking very comfortable. Morgan Freeman is terrific as usual and really suits the part so well. The story is not complicated but then it doesn't have to be - its a human interest story at its heart. I loved this movie. Its right up there beside Bladerunner, Star Wars and The Fifth Element on my shelf of "classic"(!) sci-fi films.

Review title: Great movie for all the fans of the genre
Review_body: Even today, I still can enjoy this movie. The visual effects are great, accurate and real as they can be in such a movie. And the soundtrack and the sound effects - just awesome! You can simply watch this movie over and over again, just for pure entertainment.In the recent years this kind of movies are very rare, so rare that every true sci-fi fan will appreciate this one.

I love science fiction and I generally like Tom Cruise movies but this was disappointing. This movie had so much potential but all any viewer could care about was Tom Cruise's character, if at all,, no other character was given enough time on screen to even think about. So its about saving the world but i didn't see more then a few dozen people needing saving and i did not care about any of them. Sorry Morgan Freeman, i love you, but you needed a lot more time in this film. They could have done so much with those on earth so we would care, like the Matrix, we cared through 3 films about those survivors, in this movie i did not care. Disappointing.

I found it interesting though I cannot say I was truly entertained. If you have the time, it is worth seeing on a stream service or DVD. Feel fortunate you did not pay theater prices for the big screen. The cast is sound, performances are good, and I won't give anything away. This is basically a "one-trick pony" on a big budget. Pay attention even so and you will get all of the answers.... Unlike too many reviewers who were still left baffle because of intricacies. So be warned and lower your expectations. Especially if (like me) you have already seen / read SF for over 35 years Take a ride for two hours. Just don't pay anything more to do so than you have to.

Review title: Will Someday Be Considered A Sci-Fi Classic
Review_body: I rarely buy Blu-Ray/DVDs anymore but I wanted to own this for my collection. I loved this film. I think it deserves to be considered among the classics of science fiction. This is a character and story driven film more than an action adventure, although it has enough action to make it fun to watch. It's visually stunning, owing to the fact that it was shot mostly "in camera," meaning that the sets and location are almost entirely real with only as much CG as needed. The actors are acting in real spaces and not in front of green screens. The musical score is unique and original and integrates very nicely with the visuals.I love that the story reveals its surprises as it goes along and isn't predictable. I love that the scenery, sets, objects and such in the film are beautiful to look at. It reminds me in many ways of Forbidden Planet, another sci-fi classic that's still fun to watch over 50 years after it was made. I got the same excited feeling watching Oblivion as I had when I saw Forbidden Planet, Alien and Blade Runner for the first time way back when, the feeling that I was watching something really cool.

Oblivion is a truly ground breaking and unique film. The thought and ideas put into the creation of the story and world are incredible! I can't even explain how spectacular this movie, I strongly urge you to buy and support the artists that made this movie. Tom cruise did an excellent job. The designers created everything you see in this movie to scale to make a truly realistic experience. The sky tower was designed beautifully! Everything you see around it is real footage filmed from the top of a volcano in Iceland and projected on set to add a whole new level of detail to Oblivion. The director is a true visionary! Overall, ten out of ten, this movie is emerging and will have you on the edge of your seat and will leave you thinking and inspired after you watch it. It's movies like this that make me want to go into the media business.

Obviously I am in the minority, but this is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Try and find the plot........ Not that you end up caring enough to even find it. May be if you are an avid science fiction expert you can fill in the yawning gaps , YEs it is basically a love story, though why you would care about either character who would know. Tom Cruise is acting in the only way he knows and that is playing the character of Tom Cruise. And that is not a recommendations by any means. Sorry but I would suggest going to the dentist for your overdue check up before you waste time watching this complete load of rubbish. It is an insult to one's intelligence

Review title: Gorgeous but flawed - doesn't live up to its potential
Review_body: This is most definitely a worthwhile use of your time if you are a fan of science fiction. The first 1/3 or maybe even 1/2 or so of the movie is utterly captivating, thematically, visually, and especially sonically, and the acting is quite compelling.(I have to make a note here about the sound design, especially in the beginning... it is really spectacular and original, blending perfectly with the original music composed by M83, as well as the visual aesthetic.) Unfortunately the film comes apart at the seams in some regards...I think it starts to lose steam about the time of the dramatic reveal, when the mystery and ambiguity of the situation goes up in smoke, and there are unfortunately no further plot twists left. (One more Shyamalan-esque turn would've earned this movie a lot of points in my book).There are also a number of pretty extraneous-feeling action/chase sequences, with a lot of extremely worn out Hollywood tropes. Morgan Freeman is utterly underused as an actor, and Olga Kurylenko's performance was unimpressive. Actually that might not be her fault, because Julia's character was rather unimpressive.This brings me to a final point: there are no really positive female characters in this movie. Julie is there only to further elaborate Jack's character, and to give him someone to save and protect, "Sally" is just a bitch, and Victoria, although she is wonderfully portrayed by Andrea Riseborough, is a deeply flawed character, ultimately a tool of the system, more interested in safety and security than knowing the truth (and saving our planet/species). As she says herself, "I don't want to know." This just strikes me as very unbalanced, if not worse (and I am a guy).I must say that I did like how they tied everything together at the end by cutting between present day and the events on the Odyssey, as Jack listened to the flight recorder.All in all, this is worth your time, definitely has its moments, but is too uneven to get my full endorsement. Points for tackling the themes of cloning, memory, identity, and AI (and bonus points for just being so gorgeous and visually/sonically convincing), but ultimately this was too Hollywood and not enough Moon (see Moon 2009, by Duncan Jones).

Review title: A movie that will blow the unspoiled mind.
Review_body: I admit I may be prejudiced because I am a sci-fi enthusiast yet the reason I find this movie far above average is that it succeeded in making me not want to guess the storyline before it unfolds but rather made me want to just drift along on this wave of intelligent sci-fi. The story is so well accompanied by visual prowess it will envelope the unspoiled mind. If one could see this movie without having seen any movie ever before it would stay in your mind forever. Imagine having only read books and used your imagination to play out the stories in your mind and then see this film: it would certainly blow your unspoiled mind. The acting is also far above average. The emotions are not discussed and debated and chewed up and spit out and digested again as in Woody Allen flicks, yet are held inside most of the time and are revealed visually on the characters faces. This movie goes into my top 10. For sure.

Review title: Amazing CGI and that's about it!
Review_body: This film is definitely worth a watch to while away a few hours of your life without too much pain. You certainly won't get bored but you will recognise the classic Tom Cruise "type-casted" alpha male fillers that we are all used to in about... ooh nearly ALL his films.The CGI is incredible and the first 20 minutes of this film is very impressive but underneath the gloss of the special effects is a story that could have been far better... however as with all post-apocalyptic stories they are too BIG to fit in one film.This was always going to be a let down on story execution.What you have is a film that focuses on a few individuals that save the day and a lot of background scene setting you have to take for granted. As an engaged viewer you don't really care about the characters very much, your relationship with them throughout the story is pretty distant.Tom Cruise is at the centre of everything in fact I don't think there is a single time where the camera is not following him, except for a few minutes toward the end.If you are looking for a great story, Oblivion is not going "blow your socks off" but to pass the time, it certainly suffices.

Review title: Smart, thought provoking Sci-Fi with Twists
Review_body: I really enjoyed this movie. Tom was excellent, as well as all the other actors. I love the fact that the movie kept throwing out twists that I didn't see coming. I don't know what it is about future destruction, but I always love these movies...be it Matrix, I am Legend, or Bladerunner. In fact, this movie reminded me of a cross between Gataca, Bladerunner, and Matrix. Very cool.I will be watching it again.Spoiler Alert... I love the whole twist on the enemy. Who was it? It was the Alien Skavs. It was Sally. But who is Sally? I also loved the character development with Jack Harper. The whole clone thing was a cool twist. Him meeting himself, and both of the "Jacks" were obviously stuck by it. Then when the met Mrs. Harper, Jack #52 was obviously struck by her as well. Anyways, I'm rambling.It was smart movie and I enjoyed it.

It looked like the writers had a pretty good story, and a pretty good budget. That being said, it seemed that any time that there was an opportunity to produce a scene multiple ways, it was done the wrong way. It appeared as if this was the directors first film, even though I am sure it was not.There was the swimming scene with Tom and the female lead. They were talking, rough-housing, and making commotion from one camera angle, and then it switched angles, and Tom was swimming silently by himself and nothing was going on! It appeared that the director asked for the crew to get some "B Roll" of Tom just treading water, and they'd just edit it in somewhere.I also hate to bash Tom Cruise, since it is assumed that it is the bias from him going crazy, but it is not. One of my favorite movies is The Last Samurai. That being said, he was pretty not believable in this movie. It looked like he was collecting a paycheck.I gave this movie a fair shake, and saw this over another movie I was sure that I'd love, and was incredibly disappointed. I only gave it 3 stars because the special effects were fairly well done, and the story was fairly original and interesting.

Sterile and passionless if occasionally visually interesting. An utterly derivative and mostly stupid mishmash of worn-out tropes and assembly- line Hollywood plot modules. I was never able to summon interest in the activities or fates of the characters, most of whom behaved as robotically as the moronic alien supercomputer.The sci-fi aspect is particularly bad, as not a single piece of it makes a lick of sense. Invading the Earth and stealing our oceans for the bloody deuterium is just stupid. There is a LOT of hydrogen and oxygen out there in the universe, and of all the things that make our beautiful planet special the isotope ratio of our water is not one of them.Additionally, the dramatic pauses really got to me. The action sequences are littered with them. Especially the end scene where Jack futzes around with his magic nuke bomb while monologuing made me sigh.

One of the best Sci-Fi movies ever made . My self being a avid fan of Sci Fi movies and book fan. Has the right body in the start, the body of the story and the ending. each area was just right with the right amount of story line , emotion and suspense with a very clever write up. Super performance by Tom cruise,Olga Kurylenko,Andrea Riseborough and of course Morgan freeman.Tribute the director and producer and all the staff who made it happen. Its been a while where was able to watch a good Sci-fi flick. With this one , it hit the bulls-eye.the sound track is amazing , applause M83 and the beautiful voice of Susan Sunanne Sundffor A true winner- My personal rating 10/10. I cannot imagine anything which could have been done better.

Review title: I really cannot believe this!!! (how much time I wasted)
Review_body: I decided to watch the movie because it scored 7/10 by >10^4 people.I decided to make an account on IMDb and write my first review because of this movie and its score, in order to save some people from suffering what I suffered.Unfortunately, IMDb does not allow to give a 0 to a movie, so I just stick with 1.The effects are nice, but a bit (a lot) too much. More like a dream-state than future. Everything shines in the future??? I mean, Jesus Christ, do they spent all of their time polishing everything to be shiny? Completely ridiculous, although, I admit, there was much work involved.Plot? The same Scientology garbage...give me a break really. All such scenarios are centered around the same stupid idea, which although it can be intriguing to someone, it makes horrible movies. Oh, by the way, it's completely linear and toy like, like making a 10-year old write a Scientology script. Congrats.Directing? The most slow movie I have seen for a long time. Hey guys, really, you could have saved lots of money if you just put some pictures to be displayed for 10 seconds instead of making useless animations which consist 70% of the movie without any meaning. Next time, hire me, I'll save you money big time ;) Acting? I would mention it if there was some, even bad.To sum up. Worthless scenario, with exaggerated visual effects and no actors. Plus, that it is a torture that lasts 2.5 hours.My advice: Guys, there are so many other films that score 2 or 3/10 and with shorter durations. Choose one of these and you will thank me ;)

Dear IMDb readers, Up to this day, I've never bitten of nails like in this movie. It wasn't boring though it was 124 minutes long. I enjoyed it fully till the end. I was surprised that this story was so intriguing and was sort of a mystery/"have to think" movie. I thought this would be not as good as it was. It exactly showed me the movie I needed after a long day of school. I found this at least a note-worthy movie which has a chance to be in the top 5 2013. I hope others will love it too. I know they will. This is the movie the world needs. This is one to remember.Dear love, Benjamin.

Just finished watching the film for a second time through. First time through at an extreme screen cinema and the second at home. At both locations the film was fantastic in terms of visual and sfx. The film was very well directed with a range of creative and visually pleasing shots and film techniques. The storyline itself was great with plenty of exciting twists and turns in the storyline. Admittedly, the first hour is not as exciting and the second - however it worked to explain the storyline which was one of the greatest aspects of the film. Definitely a must see - even after my second viewing I was able to enjoy and learn more about the film.

Review title: entertaining ... but all together just average
Review_body: A lot of People say this is an awesome movie, but I personally disagree. It is a nice to watch Movie but simply not great. Why? First of all many scenes are stolen. The Intro? Saw that in Aoen Flux. Second: The Planet being a total desert. Is also just copied from Planet of Apes (old one). And the basic idea of clones not knowing that they are cloned: Blade Runner. So the feeling after the Movie for me was simply: saw it before and mainly done better. The Love story is unbelievable - you can't feel or see it between Tom Cruise and Olga Kurylenko. Cruise playing his standard MI character and Olga K. just being beautiful is not enough. Andrea Risenborough is the only believable character in the movie. And great actors like Morgan Freeman are simply wasted. So 5 out of 10 because I have been worse entertained but a great Movie is something different.

First things first... 3 points because of main actor :) Co z his Name is Costner. Another gimmick: upper- London accent of his female companion on that mission. And there it stops for me. The rest is crappy bull-sh... from start to end- And I am a huge fan of sci- fie- genre. Non of those p pl making this flick seemed to have any steady connection to reality. They take great effort to deny logic in every single choice. A few examples: the Moon got a B.I. G. crate... estimated 25 % shot away. That is a giant use of energy to achieve what?: Film: Instant Tsunamis, Hurricanes and so on... ridiculous. A simple H- bomb placed west of Norway or southeast Portugal or one/ two other marks of defection had the same effect- with a million time less effort or energy- waste. Energy-waste is the big thing in this Film: Remember- this is a Mission to gather remaining resources... and there are sky-floating Bauhaus- homes as center of command with a huge outdoor- swimming-pool (makes a lot of sense in an altitude of some few thousand meters );a kind of helicopter with turbine- gear instead of rotors all glass and white and fancy but effective? Not after law of physics on earth:)) drones that defy gravity and are charged by battery- pods but have side-cannons instead of center-cannons , front-area of detecting and- measuring tools,instead of rings and so on. Costners gun I think, has been stolen from Star-wars clone- troopers and fancy-ed up with some lights on the side and a reading 'Caution'... lo l.But the best of all: the colors of equipment: shiny silver and bright white. Situation is hostile with more or less permanent enemy- contact. Surroundings are typical earth : brown, yellow, green gray. Would you seriously choose those colors in that kind of situation? Uh m mm then there is the chain of command- or (widely) absence of that and .... well I better stop now....This whole plot is so ooh off. Would think those 'Aliens' them self wrote that.

It seems to me that the Hollywood movie producers view most of the general public as easily confused individuals. And why am I saying that? Because they seem to serve again and again convoluted story with holes as wide as Atlantic ocean trying to cover it with extremely nice visuals and special effects.There are some spoilers ahead so be warned :)We have in this "movie" Tom Cruise with some girl, stranded on some levitating platform and scouting his assigned area with fancy looking ship, moto bike and so on. Than at some point Tom Cruise meets another girl in hibernation, that turns out to be his wife (or was his wife). Tom Cruise has doubts and flees with wife. After being chased by nasty looking robots Tom Cruise encounters another Tom Cruise and plot thickens. They fight and "our" Tom Cruise wins. Then they uncover to us that aliens used army of Tom Cruises to conquer the world. So Tom Cruise goes to alien mother ship to settle the score. They let him in and we see a inside a chamber a lots of hibernation cells with Tom Cruises. Lots of them... I shrieked - "Oh my God it's full of Tom Cruises!" while hibernated Tom Cruises mumbled "Sake... Sakeeee... "Tom Cruise together with Morgan Freeman blasts alien mother-ship and the only Tom Cruise left was the one defeated by now dead Tom Cruise. So the surviving Tom Cruise goes to meet his wife and they live happily ever after. So how to end this review? Tom Cruise, Tom Cruise, Tom Cruise...

Aside from it being a little slow paced near the beginning I still found this movie to keep me on the edge of my seat. There were plenty of times when I was thinking "Is there going to be a jump scare!?" The movie itself was fantastic and I would watch it ten times over. Around half way through the movie I had guessed what the ending would be like and I was almost dead on, but it still surprised me and didn't change my opinion one bit. I'd recommend this to anyone that doesn't like too much action and enjoys to actually sit and pay attention the whole time because there is some key moments in the movie. This was my first review I am sorry if it sucks. :)

Completely predictable, less than plain women, boring throughout. The only redemption is that it cost me nothing but time, IE moments of my life I will never get back. Certainly on a par with Disney's failed foray into the genre, The Black Hole though with less acting talent. Even Morgan Freeman seems to have phoned this one in, though at his age, I can't blame him for taking it easy with his remaining years. If it takes you more than 5 minutes to know the plot, you'll probably love this tripe. I am surprised this movie only lost 40 million dollars though I suspect that is mainly to do with it not being made for DVD to start with. If not for the cast, one would assume this were a SciFi channel movie, as good as they're known to be. I am being exceedingly generous with a 3 out of 10

Review title: Great depth, you must watch 2-3 times to get it
Review_body: Despite the undoubtedly awesome aesthetics, the smooth photography, a great Tom Cruise and an even great Andrea Riseborough, the movie has actually a fantastic plot. There are plenty of hints around the movie in times that you will not get them, but will shape you a feeling you will not be able to understand. The movie's depth is great, you will need to watch it 2-3 times to fully understand a look, a word or even a slight move in the first 3 minutes that actually gives a big hint about what is happening around.Finally, in lots of scenes but also in general, there are plenty of messages-opinions having to do with modern people's way of living.PS. The music is....fantastic. It connects superbly with every scene.Best movie in 2013 for me.

This is one of that kind of movies that are special, with a perfect plot. For those who like Sci-Fi, I think they will love this movie. Because the complicated history it has, makes the watcher not to know who are the good, and who are the bad. It may be difficult to understand first, but after watching again some parts, you should be able to understand it and worth it. The only reason I didn't like this movie is what happens with the protagonist's girlfriend. Anyway as they say "Another day in paradise"... I love this sometime utopia... sometime dystopia movie... Also because it shows the reality which the business and richest persons make us to see. Summarizing, I recommend to watch "Oblivion".

Sci-fi as a genre tends to repeat or plunder itself from Jules Verne to Isaac Asimov to Arthur C Clarke the same themes reoccur questioning mans place on Earth and in the known universe. I missed Oblivion at the multiplex because I believed a critic when they said it had nothing new to offer. But on viewing the Blu-ray version at home alone with no distractions I was able to glean that this was an excellent movie premise with good plot twists . Yes I've seen Moon and other sci-fi this movie /graphic novel adaptation borrows from but what I came away with was what its like to want to be and remain human.. and how love of another person or the earth itself can reinforce your humanity. I hope that Universal eventually recoups the $120,000,000 spent getting this to the screen( $84,000,000 gathered so far ) and the movie gets the following it deserves and remember... its no John Carter of Mars !!

it goes without saying that this contains spoilers but i better check that box anyway.i was very disjointed with the very final scene where the wife is with her daughter in the garden and then out of nowhere another jack (no. 52) shows up like i'm supposed to share the same bond i had with no. 47. I mean sure he has similar memories up to a point but jack #47 was unique the other jacks may not have found the forest shack or collected all the trinkets and then you are left asking wtf? Personally i wish the movie ended when they showed the other survivors walking in with no jack no.52 searching for 3 years garbage. Completely cut to black after looking back to the wife and daughter holding hands. in a heroic " this is life" moment. end credits

Whether you enjoy this film depends in what you want out of watching a film. Film quality is great, acting is good. I can't remember seeing Morgan Freeman acting badly in any film I have seen. Tom Cruise Is Tom Cruise. Sometimes good, sometimes OK. Here I thought he was good. I'm afraid the actors were let down by the storyline though. Basically the writer has watched Independence Day, The Matrix and Moon and merged them together. Quite predictable. Ending was a bit corny. Seemed to be made for that part of the US audience who don't like bad things. Apologies for the sweeping statement but it was already an end of mankind type film where mankind comes through adversity with some sacrifice along the way and then to sugar coat it at the finale was pretty poor in my book.

Oblivion is a film that succeeds in something that is increasingly uncommon in films, especially high-caliber, visually elaborate films. It ties up the bundle leaving no loose ends. When the movie ends it gives the viewer a sense of satisfaction; a sense that everything in the film had a purpose and the different elements were in balance. The film is visually impressive to watch and the setting of the story is capturing. There is action but not too much to undermine the atmosphere and mystery of the story. The dialogue is not excessive either and that which is there is well thought through. The characters are convincing, both in script and in the performance of the actors. The story line is one that could easily give rise to a 2-hour explanatory monologue and far from all questions that may arise in the viewer are answered. However, in this case that is not a problem. The film itself doesn't address more questions than it answers. It does not attempt to explain everything; it focuses on only a few characters and their story, no more. This is why Oblivion succeeds rather well. It does not try to take a bigger bite than what a 2-hour film can chew. The result is a well-working balance that is enjoyable to watch and satisfying afterwards. For anyone who finds the film's genre interesting, Oblivion is worth to watch as it easily ranks among the better sci-fi productions of past years.

This movie is OK, worth a watch at least. That is if you're not someone who will be bothered by the fact that:1.) this is a mediocre rehash of every sci-fi movie that came before it. I mean, even as a tribute to the great movies you're ripping off you could introduce something new to the mix (see Cabin in The Woods for an example of worthwhile tributes). but no, not here. 2.) any romantic subplots that exist are entirely undone by a complete lack of chemistry between the characters. that's not to say the acting is bad, it isn't. there's just no emotion between these characters. 3.) well, mostly just number 1 on my list really... oh, wait!4.) there seems to be no motivation, or at least no explanation for the motivations of the alien or the robot or whatever the hell it is. further more, no explanation of what it is exactly (i have to assume that it's HAL from the future who's traveled back in time to exact his revenge). no mention of where it came from, why it needs water or why it's really stupid. A little bit of back story goes a long way, even a tease to get the imagination working (an advanced civilization created a machine that transforms water into energy and now it's gone haywire, reeking havoc across the galaxy. this is just off the top of my head here). over all this is a movie for people who've never seen movies and don't require much of them. but if you've got some time to kill or just wanna space out to some big budget scifi it's worth the 2 hours.

I'm not surprised by the mediocre scores - it is a movie that wants to engage with people at a more intellectual level. It doesn't spoon feed the audience an infantile plot - you are going to need to think a little about this one. Great movie and very thought provoking.The CGI and action sequences in this movie are very good, but it's not what this movie is about and the lack of constant action is not going to entertain some. As this movie does not move at 100 mph and has some complex ideas and a darker moodiness to it, it will not appeal to everyone. However, if you like a movie that provokes thought, that leaves some deeper philosophical questions and ties it together with high production values, you will love this one.As I watched this movie, I queried some of the plot choices and see many of the same questions I asked myself here on this site. As the movie progressed though, these queries were answered. There are no inconsistencies and everything fits into a tight package. A lot of it does not becomes clear until we hear the flight recording toward the end. For me it was an 'oh yeh' type moment that helps fit things in place, such as why Jack was with Victoria.Quite a few spoilers coming up.I read some comments that criticised the ending - someone called it facile resolution. I think this is wrong. The resolution wasn't about having to go in guns blazing at the end, the resolution came from beating the system. Having to fight his way to the Tet or overcome physical barriers put up by the Tet would belittle the battle to discover who he was and why he was there.Why did it take the scavs 60 years to bring down the spacecraft? It could have been five years or it could have been 500 years. Presumably they had not captured a drone until this point and didn't need the fuel cells from the spacecraft until then. Capturing the drone motivated this action. It took time to capture the drone because time was needed to progress to a point where spare parts were in short supply and the drones could not be reliably repaired. Why weren't there enough spare parts? I think this was a plug for the human capacity to resist and employ guerrilla tactics - something an alien being may not have expected.What a remarkable coincidence that jack's wife was on the spacecraft. No it wasn't. Jack and his wife were both on the spacecraft originally. Jack and Victoria were the only humans to come into contact with the Tet as they were in the lunar module - the reason they were cloned and manned the towers on earth - the remainder of the spacecraft was left to orbit earth. It was clear that the Tet didn't really understand humans and human relationships. It explained why Jack and Victoria had such an unusual relationship and were not entirely compatible - which was really well portrayed and added good tension in the earlier part of the movie.What did the aliens need all the power for? It is not explained and not relevant to progressing the story.For me the movie raised a lot of other questions about clones. If I am a clone with the same memories as the original, am I for all intents and purposes the original. Is Jack 52 just as much the father to Julia's daughter as Jack 49?

Review title: Decent premise, middling execution, horrible waste of a character.
Review_body: I would not recommend spending money on this movie. The basic plot line is sound and the core idea is excellent, but as other reviews note they screw it up by surrounding it with tropes and clichés all over the place. Up until the "reveal", I was engaged. After that, not so much. The biggest issue I actually had with it was that after discovering and rescuing Julia, I was initially stoked for her character as being someone with some presence and command. In short, she seemed badass (selected for a secret space mission, sharp enough to stop herself being sedated moments after regaining consciousness, clear objective to retrieve the recorder). For a moment it looked like the character depth of the movie was stepping up and the whole thing would be more interesting.But... if I remember right, after they retrieve the recorder, her only lines were basically "Jack!", "Jack...?" and "Jack -". As soon as she's played the part of supplying the recorder she turns into this foil for the main character to obsess over his past (while she looks on silently), gets shot just so that Jack needs to go to a certain place, and strips down to a tank top on a cold- looking windy landscape for no apparent reason. Since Jack apparently did not feel sweaty enough to even roll up his sleeves, it's hard to not feel like this was simply to provide a bit of sex appeal for the emotional scene at the binoculars, and lying prone in the cave. Lame handling of a really promising character and perfectly represents the film's total two- dimensionality.

I wanted to watched this film long ago, and on Tuesday I did.Well, I'm not so impressed. When I saw the trailer, I thought this would be a great film - I love this kind of Sci-fi ones.The graphics is great, and the romantic line is cute. the actors also did a great job. However, there are many glitches and illogical events in the story.Like: when Jack enters the 'radiation zone' with his ship, the ship switches off and he cannot start it up again. However, when he steals the ship from the other Jack, he can enter the radiation zone without the ship switching off.Also, the story is a bit slow at the beginning, and in the end it's too fast. The very end is - in my opinion - awful. I'm on the opinion that it could have been much better. For watching it once it's good, but I don't think I'll watch it again.

No spoilers. I was very shocked at some of the negative reviews as I can be quite a harsh critic myself but in my opinion this movie is a solid 8/10. For a movie like this that has a lot to give and explain I think 2 hours is a good run time, at no point did the movie feel long winded. I am not a massive Cruise fan but he plays this role very well. Others have pointed out some flaws and no doubt like everything it isn't perfect but if you are looking for some interesting, thought provoking and moving sci-fi then give Oblivion a watch.p.s World class soundtrack!

If you aren't able to give this movie 1000+% of your attention while it is running, then don't even try to watch it. Even then, you will more than likely have a bad migraine at the end anyway. Unlike great sci-fi time travel/third dimension shows like the Back To The Future series that enable the viewer to follow some level of plot complexity well, this film forces the viewer to analyze and re-analyze every event ad-nauseum with the only result being severe progressive confusion.When it attempts to "pull it all together" 10 minutes before the film's end, the many pieces of confused sub-plots and key events cannot be either: 1) Logically reconciled to better explain the overall plot up until that point, or 2) Explain clearly how or why Jack (Tom Cruise) ended up with Morgan Freeman instead of Julia in the alien mother ship, and how the bomb ended up with them when it was obvious that Kara could read Jack's vital signs and more, but not detect the presence of a large nuke? Of course, every sci-fi show has to have clones in it, doesn't it? What's worse is that even on my 50" plasma screen it was hard to tell (and I'm still not absolutely sure) that they were all clones of Jack and Victoria mounted in the wall of the ship. Other reviewers seem to be not remarking about the very end when Jack ends up back at his mountain shack and all live happily ever after with kids and all.Bottom line is too late in coming, and too much left to the imagination of the already severely confused victim of this movie. A movie that makes any viewer with more than a room temperature IQ work this hard to be entertained isn't worth the time or the effort, even if it DID make sense at the end. Thank God this was on my cable premium channel so that I did not have to pay for it in a theater or as an On-Demand.I actually felt bad that Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman put their names on this psychotic venture. I am a fan of Cruise for great performances in flicks like Born On The Fourth Of July, Rain Main, and A Few Good Men. Morgan Freeman deserves everyone's respect for all his great dramatic roles. So I guess he was fooled into showing up because they told him his character Beech had a "God-like" persona. Besides, George Burns could not return from the third dimension to play the part. Burns must should been the Director Joseph Kosinski's first choice, as they both live in some other dimension, or should I say reality or realm of sanity as in Joseph Kosinski's case.I rated it (generously) at 3 stars only for some exciting and well executed visual effects. But these days, that criteria alone does not justify its existence.

Review title: Perfect science fiction of recent times
Review_body: oblivion runs slow in the beginning but later it goes with lots of twists and turns ,keeps you engaged till the end. the movie seriously has great and original movements , perfect one liner dialogs , heart touching performance from cruise , no other actor could replace cruise , excellent screenplay, outstanding background score from m83, all goes perfect in this film what else you expect than this kind of standard promising film.Tom cruise perfect choice of opting this film.Climax part has been done well with mix of twisted drama which gives you good complete feel of movie. Oblivion takes place on a futuristic version of earth in the year 2077. A war has broken out between two sides: Humans and Alien Scavs. The humans won the war, but it cost them the earth. They used nukes, which solved the problem temporarily but has forever ruined the earth's surface. The remaining inhabitants that survived the war are living on one of Jupiter's moons. Orbiting above the earth there is a space station called the Tet. Inside of the Tet is Sally (Melissa Leo). She gives orders to Jack (Tom Cruise) and Julia (Olga Kurylenko) who are the last 2 survivors on Earth. Jack is a drone repairman. His job each day is to fix the drones that Julia assigns him (Alien Scavs like to shoot down the drones and steal the cores of them for their use). With only 2 weeks remaining and vivid flashbacks of his past, can he make it off the earth to be reestablished with the human population?This movie has quite a bit of action and plot twists; in fact you will probably be at the edge of your seat throughout the whole movie. The special effects for the scenes in space are through the roof, amazing. For someone like me, who appreciates the reality of space, they did a great of portraying it. Especially when they were describing how the Alien Scavs had blown up the moon. The camera slowly pans up in the night sky and you can see the moon with blown up bits around it. A music group known as M83 made the soundtrack. Many people know this group for their song titled, "Midnight City". I really think music can make or break how much a scene matters and they did a great job with the movie score. It stars Tom Cruise, but also has Morgan Freeman in it and he is great in this movie. I can't say too much about Morgan Freeman except that I wish he would have had more of a role in the movie, but he is present in the movie for a little. The costumes actually play a big role in the movie. They are designed really well and are used in the movie for more than looks. For example, the Alien Scavs use fighter jet helmets not only to hide their faces, but because they have radio's built into them for communication and it masks their voice from being comprehensible. They use these throughout the whole movie and many other props. The movie is around the 2-hour mark, so it's slightly longer than an average movie but they do not waste time, something is always going on. Instead of being like a movie that could really be less than an hour but they end up dragging it one for an hour and a half. Overall I think that this would be a good movie for anyone who likes Action/Sci-Fi genre movies. The movie is visually stunning and the plot is brilliant. This movie will definitely leave you wondering whether something like this could ever happen in real life.

Review title: Nothing monumental. Really enjoyed it nonetheless :)
Review_body: In a world where the post-apocalyptic/alien invasion setting has been done a thousand times over, it's certainly difficult to find something that sets itself aside from the others. Oblivion is one such film. Though some have complained about the clichés and plot holes, I personally believe that it easily makes up for these things with its originality in concept and overall likability. I have tried to find another movie to compare it to. I just can't. No other film of this kind has left me so intrigued and then satisfied at the films conclusion. And when I say intriguing, I mean really intriguing. Even the bad marketing that Oblivion had prior to its release didn't ruin this. Now I may be praising this film but I do acknowledge the issues that others have brought up. It's far from a perfect film. Oblivion just appealed to me in a special way... Its a delightful treat of originality with some clichés sprinkled here and there. If you can learn to look past it's issues and enjoy oblivion for its original concepts, intriguing plot, likable characters, on screen romance, and highly satisfying ending, this film delivers.

I thought this movie was very interesting, exciting, and kept me wondering what was going to happen next. The only thing I didn't quiet understand was how easily Julia could fall in love (or stay in love) with someone she knew was a clone of her husband, rather than her actual original husband. That part was a bit weird. I also don't think that a clone would have resurfacing memories of the person they were cloned from. That was a bit far fetched as well.One of my favorite things about this movie was the small space ship that Tom Cruise pilots. Damn that was an awesome space craft! You could see in the movie how the brilliance of the technology and design in the space craft (as well as the "drones") would make them extremely "effective".

Two only for Morgan Freeman and some decent camera work. 8 points off for being so bad it literally made me angry. I have not seen Moon and I will try not spoil anything signifcant for you, but if you have seen one scifi movie, don't waste one second of your life with this. I was so excited going into the theater, I thought the premise looked great. I like post apocalyptic films and have no problem with Tom Cruise. First point, the pacing is terrible. There are moments that drag on endlessly, then things perk up a bit, back to dragging. If the characters were more engaging the slow spots might not have been too bad, but they are not. Tom is the best of the lot. No one else really has anything to do or contributes much on screen. The Vica character was as useful as the computer on Star Trek, but less charming, to call the rest caricatures would be kind, mainly they are just fodder for the drones. Plot holes, OMG. I lost count at how many, but here's a few that really burned, the drones can either not be shot down with about a million bullets fired at them, or just one bullet will take care of them, Come on! Two, spoiler - given that Vica has Jack (Tom) on a very short leash when did he have time to make his cabin in the woods? Three, spoilerish when the ship is ejected and sent back to earth, where did it go b/c it never landed on earth? Was it just in orbit? How did the folks here know it was there and how to get it down? Did NASAs records survive the annihilation? Also, and then I will close, the story is repetitious, painfully repetitious. I don't mean just that it rips off so many better films, I mean the movie shows the same scene many,many,many,many times. Like spoiler Jacks "memories" or whatever of old Earth. You see the thoughts many times, then he meets up with a female and has the thoughts again, then he talks about the thoughts and then you see the scene again, for like the 5th time. Stop hitting me over the head with your obvious plot crap, movie! I wouldn't recommend this to anyone even to rent. There are better things to do with your time and I am thinking that includes a Brazilian.

Well, what can I say!? Yes it might not be to everyones taste but I absolutely loved this film. I enjoy sci-fi but this wasn't what I expected. The story was beautifully written, stunningly filmed. Certainly hit me enough to go and see it twice in IMAX. One thing that really did it for was the music. Perhaps the best film score I've heard for several years. The cinematography is quite something, not many sci-fi films manage to look quite so real. Some say it loses momentum during the second half but I actually felt the second half was just as strong. It really builds up to a fantastic climax that works incredibly well with the music.Yes it might be a bit predictable but that's not always a bad thing in my opinion. I enjoy being lead down a path!If you can see it in IMAX it's certainly worth spending the extra!
